common_issues.title: Copilot Response Issues and Performance Degradation
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Copilot providing vague responses, claiming it's working on a solution. This often occurs after multiple requests in a session. Performance issues like slow response times and lagging are also frequent, particularly after updates. Solutions include switching LLMs, hard resetting runtime, and updating to the latest Pieces OS and Desktop versions.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* Sean encountered a bug where Copilot wouldn't respond properly after 11 requests and responses.
* The issue might be related to the LLM being used.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot not responding to questions.
* Files not loading into context.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Switching the LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue seems to be resolved with the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* The issue will be monitored after the next update (11.2.3).

**Additional notes:**

* Sean was unable to narrow down the issue for further reproduction.
* Mark and Sam from Pieces support team assisted Sean in troubleshooting the issue.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## GitHub Issue Summary: Copilot Performance Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Copilot response time is significantly slower than before.
* Hard-resetting the active runtime does not resolve the issue.
* The issue persists even after updating to the latest versions of Pieces OS and Desktop.

**Problems Identified:**

* Performance issues with copilot after a specific update.
* Bug in the copilot experience related to clicking "Hard-Reset Active Runtime."
* High CPU usage and blocked responses.
* Copilot not reading context files.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Fix for the hard-reset bug released in a patch.
* Released Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2 with performance improvements.
* Released Desktop app version 3.1.0 with further performance improvements.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved for some users, including harshilsodani.
* There are ongoing reports of the issue persisting even after updates.
* The Pieces team is requesting information from users experiencing the issue to investigate further.

**Additional Information:**

* User JerryBenChizzy and navdeepdev459 are still experiencing lagging issues.
* mark-at-pieces offered a calendar link for real-time chat to address the issue.
* Some users might need to update to the latest versions of Pieces OS and Desktop to benefit from the fixes.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of Conversation: 

**Key Points:**

* Some users were experiencing PiecesOS running in "basic mode" on M3 Macs.
* This caused the Workstream Activity view to be inaccessible and updates from the LTM engine weren't shown.
* The "unknown origin" element in the application telemetry was due to previous installations of Pieces.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS entering "basic mode" unexpectedly on specific hardware (M3 Macs).
* Workstream Activity view being inaccessible in the desktop application.
* LTM engine updates not showing on certain systems. 
* Unknown origin element appearing in telemetry.

* Patch to PiecesOS to prevent accidental entry into "basic mode".
* Enhancement to Workstream Activity view in the smaller window size mode.
* Further investigation into the LTM engine update issue.
* Confirmation that the "unknown origin" element was a result of previous installations and not a security concern. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The patch for unexpected "basic mode" is scheduled for release.
* The workstream activity view issue is acknowledged and being worked on.
* LTM engine update issue is still being investigated.
* "Unknown origin" element is understood and not a cause for concern.

**Additional Notes:**

* Users experiencing "basic mode" can currently resolve it by restarting PiecesOS.
* Users are encouraged to share feedback for the smaller window size mode.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS High CPU Usage and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance, especially with Long Term Memory (LTM) enabled.  Issues persist across Windows versions and hardware.  Workarounds include disabling LTM, updating software, and moving data folders.  The Pieces team is actively investigating and releasing patches.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation 

**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage with Pieces OS, especially on Discord and Microsoft Edge.
* Issue occurs on both Windows 10 and 11 with different hardware configurations.
* Problem seems exacerbated with Long Term Memory engine (LTM2) enabled.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Initially, a hotfix was released but didn't completely resolve the issue.
* Further patches were released to address the CPU usage.
* One user reported that updating Microsoft Edge and WebView2 resolved the issue for them.
* Another user suggested temporarily disabling and enabling LTM2 to reduce CPU usage.
* Moving data folders to a ReFS drive with symbolic links improved performance for another user.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The development team is investigating the issue and working towards a fix to be released next week.
* While some users found workarounds, the issue persists for others, especially with LTM2 enabled.

**Additional observations:**

* VSCode extension may temporarily spike CPU usage when accessing data.

**Overall, the problem of high CPU usage with Pieces OS on Windows has not been fully resolved. Users may experience varying levels of success with proposed solutions.**

related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Multiple issues encountered by new user, leading to uninstallation.

**Key points:**

* User experienced slow performance with Long Term Memory.
* PiecesOS was unable to launch.
* PiecesOS boot-up was slow.
* User uninstalled the product.

**Problems identified:**

* Performance issues with Long Term Memory likely due to version LTM-2.
* Potential bug causing PiecesOS launch failure.
* Bug causing slow boot-up of PiecesOS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Suggesting relevant existing issues for reference.
* Providing helpful resources like documentation and YouTube channel.
* Offering to debug the issues via a call.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User uninstalled the product due to poor first experience.
* Developer reached out to the user for further discussion and debugging. 

**Additional notes:**

* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* No further updates were provided in the conversation.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS LTM Engine Activation and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported difficulties enabling the Long Term Memory (LTM) engine in PiecesOS, often due to permission issues or system conflicts. This resulted in LTM functionality being unavailable or performing poorly. Solutions involved verifying and granting necessary permissions, ensuring system compatibility, and in some cases, reinstalling or updating PiecesOS.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@kwburgess) reported issues activating LTM (Long Term Memory) engine in PiecesOS.
* The issue was suspected to be related to missing permissions on the user's local machine.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS reported all necessary permissions were enabled, but LTM activation still failed.
* The specific required permissions were not readily apparent to the user.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces suggested confirming PiecesOS had access to Screen & System recording and Accessibility permissions.
* User confirmed they had enabled all necessary permissions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user acknowledged the issue was likely due to missing permissions and expressed appreciation for the assistance.
* The specific resolution to enable LTM activation is not explicitly stated in the conversation, but it can be inferred that granting the missing permissions resolved the issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop app failing to connect to Pieces OS after update. Issues include Ollama installation failure due to missing dependencies, Pieces for Developers not launching or connecting, and Pieces Desktop getting stuck during launch. related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of Github Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Problem with installing Ollama in Pieces-OS on Ubuntu
* `curl` is missing in the Pieces-OS sandbox environment
* Manually downloading Ollama does not resolve the issue
* Pieces-OS cannot launch executables outside its sandbox

**Problems Identified:**

* Ollama installation fails due to missing `curl` dependency
* Inference and model download functionalities are impacted
* Snap package confinement prevents access to external resources

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add `curl` to the snap definition file
* Develop a patch to allow Ollama usage from the sandbox environment
* Infrastructure updates are being prioritized before a fix can be implemented

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is still present in the latest version
* Fix is expected to be released in the next week
* Manual model download is not a workaround

**Additional Information:**

* Users are waiting for a resolution to avoid relying on cloud-based LLMs
* A debug error message related to missing `curl` is reported

**Overall:**

The issue of Ollama installation failing in Pieces-OS is identified and acknowledged. A solution is being developed, but a concrete timeline for its release is not yet available. Users are advised to wait for the fix or consider alternative solutions for their LLM needs.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

## Conversation Summary for GitHub Issue:

**Key Points:**

* MoyinShabi reported an issue with Pieces for Developers not connecting to Pieces OS.
* The issue occurred after a major update with significant changes.
* MoyinShabi received no health check notifications.
* The problem was likely related to the desktop app's database and potentially something in the PiecesOS setup.

**Problems Identified:**

1. Pieces for Developers not connecting to Pieces OS.
2. Issues with the desktop app's database.
3. Potential additional issues within the PiecesOS setup.
4. Repeated GetIt package error message in the log file.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mack-at-pieces requested log files and the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* MoyinShabi provided the requested files.
* Mack-at-pieces identified and fixed a bug in the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A repaired "com.pieces.pfd" folder was provided for MoyinShabi to replace the existing one.
* MoyinShabi replaced the folder but still encountered the same issue.
* MoyinShabi shared the error message from the log file.
* Mack-at-pieces suggested a video call to troubleshoot live.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is not fully resolved.
* MoyinShabi is still experiencing the connection problem.
* A video call is scheduled for further troubleshooting.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be related to the database and potentially the PiecesOS setup.
* The GetIt package error message provides a clue about the problem.
* A video call might be necessary to diagnose and fix the issue.
